More than a year later, why not!?

Sep 15, 2015

Hey there,
This site is still maintained! I was running my personal site on pelican and I just decided to move to jekyll!

I had a small anoying problem with Pelican’s assets plugin and didn’t want to put time on fixing this. I told myself “ok I’ll continue writing when I fix this”, but turns out it never happened. Switching to an other static site generator ended up being faster to setup than playing with my old code. Yeah, I’m a bit lazy, that makes good programers right?. :)

That being said, I’ll do my homeworks and I’ll be posting here for real by following my static site generator’s Philosophy;

Put simply, Jekyll gets out of your way and allows you to concentrate on what truly matters: your content.

You got it, I’ll focus on content.

What’s new?

Well, since my last post (a year ago), a lot of things happened! These are the key points:

  • I started working at TLM, a nice place with nice people where I write code, fix problems and close Jira issues. I’m often asked what’s TLM? In a nutshell, we do a lot of things such as websites, webapps, mobile apps and some support. We worked on a car starting mobile app once and that was pretty cool ;)

  • I gave a few presentations at the SagLac IO about coffeescript, python and command line tools. I will give an other one soon on Hubot (HUBOT - Improve and reduce employee efficiency). I will share my presentations in a new post once the presentation is over.

  • I started a partnership: Totema Studio, an independant video game Studio where I am building awesome games with awesome people.

As one can read here, it’s been a buzy year, I’ll share more thoughts on my site now that it’s “fixed” ;)
